ref: 6017 *triḥśataka ʻ consisting of three hundred ʼ. [Cf. triśatá -- ʻ three hundred ʼ RV., ʻ consisting of three hundred ʼ Hariv., triśataka -- BHSk.; for triḥ cf. triḥsapta -- ʻ twenty one ʼ ĀpGr̥. ~ trisaptá -- RV. -- trís, śatá -- ]
S. ṭriso m. ʻ a kind of cloth with three hundred threads in the woof ʼ;
L. trissā m. ʻ ordinary country cloth ʼ.
